testsuite.name: 00-compile_t
01-storage_t

testcase.name: 1 - fail if cant connect to db
7 - get single acl and validate fields
8 - get all acl and validate added one
14 - expire time should be updated if acl is duplicate but have later expiry
15 - comment should be updated together with time
16 - do not add ACL that resolve to same network range

testsuite.system-out: ok 1 - fail if cant connect to db ok 2 - fail if cant create table ok 3 - An object of class 'ACLBot::Storage' isa 'ACLBot::Storage' ok 4 - empty input ok 5 - no expire ok 6 - Add ACL # Subtest: get single acl and validate fields ok 1 - proto ok 2 - src_addr ok 3 - dst_addr ok 4 - dst_port 1..4 ok 7 - get single acl and validate fields # Subtest: get all acl and validate added one ok 1 - proto ok 2 - src_addr ok 3 - dst_addr ok 4 - dst_port 1..4 ok 8 - get all acl and validate added one ok 9 - remove acl ok 10 - remove successful ok 11 - Add expired ACL ok 12 - expired acl not returned ok 13 - do not add duplicates ok 14 - expire time should be updated if acl is duplicate but have later expiry ok 15 - comment should be updated together with time ok 16 - do not add ACL that resolve to same network range 1..16

testsuite.name: 02-cisco-portmap_t

testcase.name: 2 - TCP cisco service name to port
3 - TCP port to cisco service name
4 - UDP cisco service name to port
5 - UDP port to cisco service name
6 - ICMP cisco service name to port
7 - ICMP port to cisco service name
10 - cisco uses www instead of http because fuck cisco

testsuite.system-out: ok 1 - An object of class 'Cisco::Portmap' isa 'Cisco::Portmap' # Subtest: TCP cisco service name to port ok 1 - TCP: bgp to 179 ok 2 - TCP: chargen to 19 ok 3 - TCP: cmd to 514 ok 4 - TCP: daytime to 13 ok 5 - TCP: discard to 9 ok 6 - TCP: domain to 53 ok 7 - TCP: drip to 3949 ok 8 - TCP: ftp to 21 ok 9 - TCP: ftp-data to 20 ok 10 - TCP: pop3 to 110 ok 11 - TCP: smtp to 25 ok 12 - TCP: www to 80 1..12 ok 2 - TCP cisco service name to port # Subtest: TCP port to cisco service name ok 1 - TCP: 9 to discard ok 2 - TCP: 13 to daytime ok 3 - TCP: 19 to chargen ok 4 - TCP: 20 to ftp-data ok 5 - TCP: 21 to ftp ok 6 - TCP: 25 to smtp ok 7 - TCP: 53 to domain ok 8 - TCP: 80 to www ok 9 - TCP: 110 to pop3 ok 10 - TCP: 179 to bgp ok 11 - TCP: 514 to cmd ok 12 - TCP: 3949 to drip 1..12 ok 3 - TCP port to cisco service name # Subtest: UDP cisco service name to port ok 1 - UDP: bootpc to 68 ok 2 - UDP: bootps to 67 ok 3 - UDP: netbios-dgm to 138 ok 4 - UDP: netbios-ns to 137 ok 5 - UDP: netbios-ss to 139 ok 6 - UDP: snmp to 161 ok 7 - UDP: snmptrap to 162 ok 8 - UDP: sunrpc to 111 1..8 ok 4 - UDP cisco service name to port # Subtest: UDP port to cisco service name ok 1 - UDP: 67 to bootps ok 2 - UDP: 68 to bootpc ok 3 - UDP: 111 to sunrpc ok 4 - UDP: 137 to netbios-ns ok 5 - UDP: 138 to netbios-dgm ok 6 - UDP: 139 to netbios-ss ok 7 - UDP: 161 to snmp ok 8 - UDP: 162 to snmptrap 1..8 ok 5 - UDP port to cisco service name # Subtest: ICMP cisco service name to port ok 1 - ICMP: echo to 8 ok 2 - ICMP: echo-reply to 0 ok 3 - ICMP: time-exceeded to 11 ok 4 - ICMP: timestamp-reply to 14 ok 5 - ICMP: timestamp-request to 13 1..5 ok 6 - ICMP cisco service name to port # Subtest: ICMP port to cisco service name ok 1 - ICMP: 0 to echo-reply ok 2 - ICMP: 8 to echo ok 3 - ICMP: 11 to time-exceeded ok 4 - ICMP: 13 to timestamp-request ok 5 - ICMP: 14 to timestamp-reply 1..5 ok 7 - ICMP port to cisco service name ok 8 - not udp service ok 9 - nonexisting service ok 10 - cisco uses www instead of http because fuck cisco ok 11 - fail on unknown protocol ok 12 - fail on unknown protocol ok 13 - port out of range ok 14 - port out of range ok 15 - code out of range ok 16 - NaN 1..16
